result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Don Arthur Libal

records.addlTxt:
10:37 AM Defendant Don Arthur Libal in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Don Arthur Libal.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes defendant to continue treatment. Attorney Rosenthal reviews status of defendant's treatment. Asks for status in 60 days. State does not have lab availability today. Court sets one last status conference.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:37 AM Defendant Don Arthur Libal in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Don Arthur Libal.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes matter is still unresolved and asks for another status. Attorney Rosenthal in agreement and will be reaching out to receive documentation of treatment. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:40 AM Defendant Don Arthur Libal in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Don Arthur Libal.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates offer conveyed. Asks for status.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:34 AM Defendant Don Arthur Libal in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Don Arthur Libal.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes defendant to complete treatment and requests status in July. Attorney Rosenthal in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:06 AM Defendant Don Arthur Libal appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Don Arthur Libal.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State- got results, made offer
Att Rosenthal- got offer last night
State-will be filing amended complaint.
Court sets date
Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:16 PM Defendant Don Arthur Libal appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal appeared by video for Don Arthur Libal.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal notes nothing further besides motion that was filed. Notes one failure to appear from Minnesota and requests $500 cash bail. State finds $1,000 cash bail would be reasonable. Reviews conduct and charges. Notes lab results have been received. State would be willing to amend down to $500 cash bail. Court finds $1,000 is more than reasonable. Court reviews felony charges and mandatory minimums. Court finds bond and conditions are reasonable and denies bail modification.
Defendant's motion to modify bail conditions

09:30 AM Defendant Don Arthur Libal in court with attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal.  Defendant Don Arthur Libal in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Don Arthur Libal appeared by video means with Attorney.
Att Rosenthal- received information, not guilty pleas, status in 30-45 days
Court sets date
  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:29 PM Defendant Don Arthur Libal in court with attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal.  Defendant Don Arthur Libal in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Rosenthal-request modification to 100.00; states criminal history; no failures to appear on the criminal case; local ties to the area
State is opposed to the request; felony charges; defendant has priors in WI; State believes some amount is appropriate
Court questions what the bond was in the other criminal cases
State-recent conviction that is out of Iowa; 2021 for OWI and possession of meth; no appearance history on those charges
Court denies the charges at this time; recent charges in Iowa; nature of charges and exposure is in excess of 9 years prison; allegations of trying to fight with officers and jail staff
Bond to remain at 1000.00

Atty Rosenthal-client would like to waive the preliminary hearing;  Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 09:30 am. 
Atty Rosenthal request a bail modification hearing in about 10 days
Court-January 27th at 1:30 for bail modification hearing

No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  No use or possession of alcohol.  No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No entering establishments where the primary service is serving alcohol.

No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  No use or possession of alcohol.  No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No entering establishments where the primary service is serving alcohol.

03:22 PM Defendant Don Arthur Libal in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Don Arthur Libal in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint. Attorney Hoffman acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading, and not guilty plea to the misdemeanor charges, request preliminary on Felonies. Court accepts the pleas of not guilty. 
State requests $2500 cash bond with conditions of no alcohol, no entering establishments where alcohol is served, no controlled substances. State covers criminal history of Defendant.
Attorney Hoffman inquires questions of Defendant. Attorney Hoffman requests $1000 cash.
Court orders $1000 cash bond and $3000 signature bond with conditions of no use or possession of alcohol, no drugs or paraphernalia, no operate motor vehicle without valid license or permit, no entering establsihements where the primary purpose is serving alcohol.
  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant is going to apply for Public Defenders office. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
